extendedInfo.description: Portland Transit Lite allows:  * WES, MAX, and bus arrival times  * route listings  * favourite stopsCheck out the full version for MANY more features and to support a local (PDX) developer!

reviews.title: Please change default view to saved stops
reviews.comment: I understand this is a free version. Thank you !!! However, most users have a daily commute, which means they hit the same stops day after day. Can you please update the app to default to saved stops view, instead of the search function?  Thank you again.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I just moved to portland and this app is great! It has a great layout and every transit is here! Thank you! But can you add the streetcar schedule?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: PLEASE FIX! \n{ FOR PAST MONTH IT WON\'T DISPLAY ANY TIMES }\nWhat I like best about this app is how it clearly lists stops for user to choose.

reviews.title: Terrible!
reviews.comment: Complete unreliable garbage. It constantly says a bus is coming and when the eta comes and goes the app changes to a later time.

reviews.comment: What did i ever do without this app... would be awesome if it had alarm saying bus due to arrive in whatever specified amount of time

reviews.comment: Works great.. The bus sched. At the stop is totally off but this app. Is always on point. Thank u for that. *galaxy epic g4*

reviews.title: Almost
reviews.comment: I really want to get the paid version but atleast once a week the info I get is not accurate.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Did the author ever try to use this?
reviews.comment: Basically, this is a useful app - EXCEPT! The opening screen defaults to a field where it asks you to enter a Stop ID. Where are you supposed to get that? You have an option to navigate through Route Listings. When you select that, you get a list that starts with the Max Blue, Red, etc lines. If you are a newcomer or an occasional rider you haven\'t a clue where those lines run and which one you should select. PUT THE LINE END POINTS ON THAT SCREEN, (Gresham-Hillsboro, etc). When you finally figure out which line to use, it lists the stops in narrative form (see the second example screen in the overview). INCLUDE THE STOP IDS either there, or if there isn\'t room, on the schedule page for that stop. That way, you can learn the stop id and use it the next time you need a schedule.  I am assuming, correctly I believe, that most people travel repetitively from only a handful of locations. If the default means for selecting a stop is some sort of Stop ID, then INCLUDE THEM SOMEWHERE IN THE APP!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Please update times
reviews.comment: Schedules are off, please update. Was most definitely a 5 star app, now you have to give it a 5 minute window
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Transit system change...
reviews.comment: I\'ll keep my 5 star rating because I don\'t know if the \"loading\" times are app-related, phone-/provider-related, or over-use of Tri-Met\'s system by other riders (i mean not only by this app)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: App works great! Beware that the Trimet schedules this accesses have apparently changed & are all off by 5-10mins. Google Maps has the same issue..
